page.title: 12RURAL TRANSPORT
page.content: Car ownership levels in N.E Fife are significantly higher than for Scotland as a whole: viz. 65% of housholds in N.E. Fife own a car, compared with 51% in Scotland (1981 figures). High levels of car owership and a scattered population make many bus services an uneconomic proposition and subsidies are essential for the very small communities. Post Bus services (operated by the Post Office with a Regional Council subsidy) run to Collessie once a week. The majority of respondants to our questionaire commented that public transport provision was very poor in our area. Trains linking Edinburgh with Perth run through Collessie village. One passenger train runs each day on this single track line. The nearest railway station to Collessie is at Ladybank, 5 km. away.
